description:
Discover a step-by-step guide to install Ghost on Ubuntu, then create and set up a new Ghost site and configure Ghost with Nginx.

The post How to Install, Setup, and Use Ghost on Ubuntu (Ultimate Guide) appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install, Setup, and Use Ghost on Ubuntu (Ultimate Guide)

description:
Learn how to install PyCharm on Ubuntu and other Linux distros using multiple different methods with practical examples.

The post How to Install PyCharm on Ubuntu and Other Linux Distros appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install PyCharm on Ubuntu and Other Linux Distros

description:
Laravel is a web application framework based on PHP that is used to build enterprise web applications. It’s a free and open web framework that follows model-view-controller (MVC) architecture and is based on Symfony.

The post How to Install Laravel PHP Framework on Ubuntu 24.04 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Laravel PHP Framework on Ubuntu 24.04

description:
In this guide, we’ll explore what proxies are, how to set up a proxy server, and how to make the proxy settings permanent in Ubuntu Linux.

The post How to Set Up a Proxy Server on Ubuntu appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Set Up a Proxy Server on Ubuntu

description:
Vulnerability scanning is an essential activity for enterprise security. We recommend the best free and open source vulnerability detection tools.

The post 8 Best Free and Open-Source Vulnerability Detection Tools appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 8 Best Free and Open-Source Vulnerability Detection Tools

description:
DebPostInstall is a simple Bash script to automate important post-installation tasks on a newly installed minimal Debian or Ubuntu server.

The post DebPostInstall: Your Essential Post-Installation Toolkit for Debian and Ubuntu Servers appeared first on Linux Today.
title: DebPostInstall: Your Essential Post-Installation Toolkit for Debian and Ubuntu Servers

description:
OpenBAS is an open-source platform that enables organizations to plan, schedule, and execute crisis exercises, adversary simulations, and breach simulations. Compliant with ISO 22398 standards, OpenBAS is built as a modern web application featuring a user-centric interface and a RESTful API.

The post OpenBAS: Open-Source Breach and Attack Simulation Platform appeared first on Linux Today.
title: OpenBAS: Open-Source Breach and Attack Simulation Platform

description:
WonderCMS is a lightweight, open-source content management system (CMS) designed for simplicity and ease of use. In this tutorial, we will show you how to install WonderCMS on a Debian 12 server with Apache web server and PHP 8.x.

The post How to Install WonderCMS on Debian 12 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install WonderCMS on Debian 12
